text: - [Instructor] Hello everyone.
This demo will cover how to get started
with investigations in Amazon Detective.

Also, it will highlight
the ease and flexibility
of initiating investigations
from multiple places in Amazon Detective.

Amazon Detective empowers
security teams to investigate

and determine the root
cause of security findings
and suspicious activities.

Amazon Detective investigations
use machine learning models
and threat intelligence

to automatically analyze
resources in your AWS environment
to identify potential security incidents.
It lets you proactively, effectively,
and efficiently use automation

built on top of Detective's
behavioral graph
to improve security operations.

You can use the Amazon
Detective investigations feature
to investigate IAM users

and IAM roles using
indicators of compromise,

which can help you determine
if your resource is involved
in a security incident.
Now let's get started in the AWS console
to see this feature in action.

From the AWS console, search
for Detective in the search box
and click on Detective.

From the Summary page, you can
view automated investigations
that let you investigate IAM users

and IAM roles with
indicators of compromise
to determine if a resource is involved
in a security incident.

This page lists the
critical investigations

identified by Detective and
the corresponding IAM roles
and IAM users that were impacted

by security events over
a set period of time.
As you review the summary page,

you can adjust the scope
time to view the activity

for any 24 hour timeframe
in the previous 365 days.
When you change the start date and time,

the end date and time
is automatically updated
to 24 hours after your chosen start time.

Next, I will highlight
the ease and flexibility
of initiating investigations
from multiple places in Amazon Detective.
From the Summary page,
click on Run Investigation button,

or we can select investigations
on the left-hand side

and click on the Run
Investigations button.
In the Select Resource section,
you have two ways to run an investigation.

One, you can choose to
run the investigation

for a resource recommended
by Amazon Detective.

Two, you can run the investigation
for a specific resource.

Thirdly, you can also
investigate a resource
from the Amazon Detective search page.
Let's look at the first way.

For example, you are
looking at the finding group

that has correlated bunch
of activity for you,

but you want to dive deep
into a specific IAM entity.
Choose a recommended resource.

Amazon Detective recommend
resources based on its activity
in findings and finding groups.
To run the investigation

for a resource recommended
by Amazon Detective,
in the recommended resource table,
select a resource to investigate.
The recommended resource table
provides the following details.
Resource ARN.

This is the Amazon resource
name, ARN of the AWS resource.
Reason to investigate.

This displays the key reasons
to investigate the resource.
Latest finding.

Latest findings are
prioritized on top of the list.

Resource type identifies
the type of resource,
for example, an AWS user or AWS role.
In the investigation scope time section,

choose the scope time
for the investigation
to assess the selected resource activity.
You can select a start date and start time
and end date and end time in UTC format.

The selected scope time
window can be between

at a minimum of three hours
and a maximum of 30 days.
Then you click on Run Investigation.
Let's look at the second way.

For example, you are looking
to investigate a specific role

to get a complete picture of
how this AWS role was used.
Select specify an AWS role

or user with an ARN from
Select Resource menu.
You can select an AWS role or AWS user

and run an investigation
for the specific resource.

From the select resource
type dropdown list,
choose AWS role or AWS user.
For this demo, I'll choose AWS role.

Enter the resource ARN
of the IAM resource.
In the investigation scope time section,

choose the scope time
for the investigation
to assess the selected resource activity.
You can select a start date and start time
and end date and end time in UTC format.

The selected resource
code time can be between

at a minimum of three hours
and a maximum of 30 days.
Then click on Run Investigation.
Let's look at the third way.
For example, you're looking to investigate
a specific IAM resource

to see if there's any involvement
in a security incident.
In the Navigation pane, choose Search.

In the search page, search
for an IAM resource.
For this demo, I'll select AWS role.
Then enter the principle ID, ARN,
or name of the AWS role.
Then click on Search.

For this demo, I will click
on one of the ARN link
from the example's data.
Then choose Run Investigation.

Choose the scope time
for the investigation
to assess the selected resource activity.
You can select a start date and start time
and end date and end time in UTC format.
Then click Confirm.

Understanding a Detective
investigations report
and what you can get out of it.

In the Navigation pane,
select Investigations.

Then I will select a specific
investigation report.

Based on the results
of your investigation,
you can use the details in this report
to take appropriate action
as part of your incident response plan
or for threat hunting purposes.

I'll give you a brief
overview of what you can get
out of this investigation report.

A Detective investigations
report lists a summary
of the uncommon behavior

or malicious activity
that indicates compromise.
It also lists the recommendation
that Amazon Detectives suggests
to mitigate the security risk.

The investigation report
includes the anomalous behaviors,

potential tactics, techniques,
and procedure TTPs,

mappings of observed
CloudTrail management events
and indicators of compromise

of the IAM principle
that was investigated.

For example, when
conducting an investigation
or threat hunting,

adversary will not leave you
a message about their trail.

So therefore a common
method of investigation

is to identify the
pattern of these behaviors
and use them as clues to move forward.

This information can
also help you understand

what APIs can potentially
be used by adversaries
to make impact in your AWS environment.
And whether or not the API call succeeded

tells you right away if
it made potential impact
to your AWS resources.

In this video, we explored
how you can get started
with investigations in Amazon Detective.

The video also highlight
the ease, flexibility

of initiating investigations
from multiple places

in Amazon Detective, and
what customers can get
out of an investigation.

You can try Amazon Detective
at no additional charge
with a 30 day free trial.
To learn more and get started,
check out the link in the description.
